unnormalised: Okay guys, so let's talk about Indian Airways, specifically flying *within* India. I just got back from a trip that took me from Guwahati to Mumbai, with a stopover in Delhi. Honestly, the whole domestic flying experience is a mixed bag, isn’t it?
normalised: Okay guys, so let's talk about Indian Airways, specifically flying within India. I just got back from a trip that took me from Guwahati to Mumbai, with a stopover in Delhi. Honestly, the whole domestic flying experience is a mixed bag, isn’t it?

unnormalised: First off, booking flights. I always check multiple sites like MakeMyTrip & Yatra.com. Seems like EVERY airline offers some kind of "sale" or "discount," but you gotta read the fine print, right? I ended up booking IndiGo flight 6E203, but almost went with SpiceJet just because of the cheaper base fare. It’s a constant battle to find the best deal.
normalised: First off, booking flights. I always check multiple sites like MakeMyTrip and Yatra.com. Seems like every airline offers some kind of "sale" or "discount," but you gotta read the fine print, right? I ended up booking IndiGo flight six E two hundred and three, but almost went with SpiceJet just because of the cheaper base fare. It’s a constant battle to find the best deal.

unnormalised: Then there’s the whole airport experience. Security lines are always long, especially during peak season like Diwali or summer vacations. I was carrying a power bank (20000mAh), and got stopped – apparently, it has to be in your hand luggage. Always something! And the chai at the airport costs, like, Rs. 150! Robbery, I tell you!
normalised: Then there’s the whole airport experience. Security lines are always long, especially during peak season like Diwali or summer vacations. I was carrying a power bank (twenty thousand m-A-h), and got stopped – apparently, it has to be in your hand luggage. Always something! And the chai at the airport costs, like, rupee one hundred and fifty! Robbery, I tell you!

unnormalised: On the plus side, a lot of airports have really improved in the last few years. Delhi's Terminal 3 is pretty swanky, and even smaller airports like Guwahati have gotten a facelift. Free Wi-Fi is a lifesaver for killing time, too. Though speed depends on how many others are fighting to download videos.

unnormalised: Now, the flight itself. This is where things can get REALLY interesting. I’ve had flights delayed by 4 hrs due to “operational reasons” (whatever THAT means!). Then you’re stuck at the gate with everyone else, scavenging for charging points. But when things are on time, it's usually smooth sailing. The cabin crew is generally polite, and the safety demos are… well, you’ve seen them a million times, right?

unnormalised: Regarding food, plane food is plane food. I usually just stick with the complimentary water and maybe buy a packet of Kurkure (₹30). Some airlines offer pre-booking meals online for extra Rs. 500 or so, but I’ve never bothered. I’d rather wait and grab something at the destination.

Some airlines offer pre-booking meals online for extra rupee five hundred or so, but I’ve never bothered. I’d rather wait and grab something at the destination.

unnormalised: Landing on time? That’s always a gamble. My IndiGo flight actually landed 15 mins early in Mumbai. But I’ve had other flights that circled for 30 mins before landing because of air traffic. Sigh. You just never know.
normalised: Landing on time? That’s always a gamble. My IndiGo flight actually landed fifteen minutes early in Mumbai. But I’ve had other flights that circled for thirty minutes before landing because of air traffic. Sigh. You just never know.

unnormalised: Overall, flying Indian Airways is… an experience. It’s relatively affordable (compared to other countries), but you gotta be prepared for potential delays, crowded airports, and overpriced chai. Just pack your patience, a good book, and maybe some snacks. And ALWAYS check the baggage allowance – it’s a nightmare to get dinged with extra fees at the check-in counter (Rs. 300 per kg over the limit!). Safe travels, folks!
